page.title: 04HOUSES IN THE KEIGHLEY AREA
page.content: There are examples of all types of houses in this area although certain types are more numerous than others. The oldest houses are{farmhouses}and {cottages}found in places like Oakworth Exley Head, and Haworth.These can be upto {400 years}old.Built later than these are the{terraced houses}usually associated with the industrial revolution,many being close to the old mills. Examples of both{through {terraced}and{back to back}houses are found in this area.Large{detached {houses}of a similar age were built by the mill owners.Some of these have been converted into{old peoples homes or{flats. Most houses built in the last 70 years have been {semi-detached}with garages and gardens.{Flats}and{ {bungalows}are not so numerous in this area although examples are present.
